intro: Homalium involucratum f. involucratum, commonly known as the velvetleaf or sweetshrub, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically borne on peduncles. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
